data.question: What is the formula for ZnPO-MOF?
What role does the tetratopic ligand 1,2,4,5-tetrakis(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene (1) play in the synthesis of ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: It acts as a key building block providing greater stability and permanent microporosity to the resulting MOF.

data.question: True or False: ZnPO-MOF can efficiently catalyze acyl-transfer reactions without preconcentrating the substrates within its pores.
What is the gas-accessible surface area of ZnPO-MOF as indicated by reversible CO2 adsorption isotherm?
How does ZnPO-MOF enhance the rate of acyl-transfer reactions?
data.answer: By preconcentrating the substrates within its pores and possibly through Lewis acid activation.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of ZnPO-MOF does not reveal large channels in three directions.
What is the yield percentage of ZnPO-MOF when considering the solvent weight?
What is the significance of using (5,15-dipyridyl-10,20-bis(pentafluorophenyl))porphyrin (2) in the synthesis of ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: It is metalated during the solvothermal synthesis, contributing to the catalytic activity of ZnPO-MOF.

data.question: True or False: The evacuated sample of ZnPO-MOF took up less solvent compared to the as-synthesized material.
What is the effect of the substrate isomer structure on the reaction rate in ZnPO-MOF catalyzed acyl-transfer reaction?
data.answer: There is surprisingly little sensitivity of the reaction rate to the substrate isomer structure.

data.question: True or False: The (porphyrin)Zn sites in ZnPO-MOF are inaccessible to the substrate 3-pyridylcarbinol (3-PC).
What is the role of Lewis acid (LA) activation in the catalytic mechanism of ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: LA activation involves coordination of NAI to the unsaturated (porphyrin)Zn sites, stabilizing a proximal negative charge in the transition state.

data.question: True or False: The rate enhancement observed in ZnPO-MOF catalysis is solely due to Lewis acid activation.
What is the effect of product inhibition on the catalytic activity of ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: The imidazole product acts as a modest inhibitor by competing for catalytic Zn sites, reducing the reaction rate.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of ZnPO-MOF involves a solvothermal condition.
What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: DMF is used as a solvent in which the reactants are dissolved for the solvothermal synthesis.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of (5,15-dipyridyl-10,20-bis(pentafluorophenyl))porphyrin (2) requires chromatographic work up.
How does the presence of imidazole affect the catalysis of 3-PC by ZnPO-MOF?
data.answer: The presence of imidazole, a product, considerably lowers the rate of the reaction due to its inhibitory effect.

data.question: True or False: The evacuated sample of ZnPO-MOF shows identical PXRD patterns to the as-synthesized sample.
What is the significance of the Zn−Zn separation distance in ZnPO-MOF's catalytic activity?
data.answer: The Zn−Zn separation distance of 11.6 Å might serve to orient and align the reactants in a favorable manner for acyl transfer.
